content.title: Welcome to Cecil Plains
content.introtext: <p>A huge welcome to new listeners just tuning in from the Darling Downs. Our 198th Queensland relay station is Vision Cecil Plains 88.0 FM which began broadcasting in test mode on June 28. From 6 August, it's officially on air, making it our 622nd installation nationwide.<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides"> A programme guide for Cecil Plains can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Jensen
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in from the Northern Beaches area of Townsville. Vision Jensen 88.0 FM began broadcasting in test mode on 17 June and is now officially on-air from 6 August. Thanks to Beaches Church for their support in getting the station up and running. Vision Jensen 88.0 FM is our 621st station nationwide and our 197th in Qld. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Vision can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Gidgegannup
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners from the Perth Hills. Vision Gidgegannup 87.6 FM has just come out of its testing period on July 28 and is now officially on air. We're delighted to have our 145th station in the west join the Vision family. Gidgegannup is our 620th installation nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Gidgegannup can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Manjimup
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners from King Jarrah country in WA. Vision Manjimup 87.6 FM has been in testing mode since June 4 and is now officially on air, from 21 July. We're thrilled to be able to say 'hello' to listeners tuning in to our 144th relay station in the west and our 619th station nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Manjimup can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Condamine
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Darling Downs. The new Vision relay station at Condamine went in on May 27 and is just out of its testing period. Vision Condamine Town 88.0 FM complements the already existing station Vision Condamine North 87.6 FM which went on a year ago. We're thrilled that these stations cover the mining areas where so many FIFO workers are located. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for the Condamine area can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Melbourne now fully covered!
content.introtext: <p>It's been a long-awaited installation but it's finally here! A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in to the new 1665 AM station in East Melbourne. This station is just out of testing mode and is now officially on-air. No matter where you are in Melbourne, there's now Vision coverage: 1611 AM in the western suburbs and 1665 AM on the eastern side. <a target="_blank" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Melbourne can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Freo!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to Sandgropers tuning in from Fremantle in Western Australia! Today is the official launch of our 616th installation, after a testing period since May 8. We're delighted to be able to say 'hello' to listeners in the area, whether you live in Freo or are just passing through. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Vision Fremantle 88.0 FM can be found here. </a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Leschenault
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners just tuning in from the Bunbury area of Western Australia. Vision Leschenault 87.6 FM is now out of its testing period and today (23 June) is its official launch! We're delighted to be able to give a big shout of welcome to all new listeners in Leschenault. <a target="_blank" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for the new station can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Kelso, QLD!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Townsville region of Qld. Vision Kelso 88.0 FM began broadcasting on May 4 and has just completed its testing period. We're thrilled to be able to say 'hello' to everyone listening to this station. It's our 614th installation nationwide and our 195th in Queensland. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Kelso can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Farnborough North!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Capricornia Coast of Central Qld. Vision Farnborough North 88.0 FM began broadcasting on April 30 and has just completed its testing period. We're thrilled to be able to say 'hello' to everyone listening to this station. It's our 613th installation nationwide and our 194th in Queensland. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Farnborough North can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Bridport, Tasmania!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in from the northern coast of Tasmania. We're delighted to be able to announce the first Vision station of 2015 has officially sprung to life in the Apple Isle on January 5. Vision Bridport 88.0 FM is a 612th installation nationwide and the 48th in Tasmania. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Bridport can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Wooroloo
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from Wooroloo in Western Australia. Our latest Vision station has arrived just in time for Christmas! Vision Wooroloo 87.8 FM is our 141st installation in the west and our 611th nationwide. It complements the local regional coverage at Chidlow and Wundowie, both of which stations broadcast on 87.6 FM. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Wooroloo can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Springfield Lakes
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the city of Ipswich. Vision Springfield Lakes 87.8 FM went to air on 5 December with the help of the local council. It is our 610th installation nationwide and our 193rd station in Queensland. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Springfield Lakes can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Kelleberrin, WA
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from Kellerberrin in Western Australia. On 28 November, Vision Kellerberrin 88.0 FM became the 140th relay station in the west and Vision's 609th nationwide. It's now possible to travel the Great Eastern Highway from Perth to Coolgardie, tuning in at every major town on the way: Walliston (88.0), Gooseberry Hill (87.6), Chidlow (87.6), Wundowie (87.6), Northam (87.6), Meckering (88.0), Cunderdin (88.0), Tammin (88.0), Kellerberrin (88.0), Merredin (88.0), Southern Cross (88.0), Coolgardie&nbsp;(87.6).&nbsp; For others in the same general area, <a target="_self" title="Vision Station Map" href="http://www.vision.org.au/google-maps">see our map</a>. For a programme guide for any of these towns, <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">click here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Mt Isa
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners just tuning in from our newest station: Mt Isa in North Queensland. Vision Mt Isa 88.0 FM went to air for the first time on 21 November. It's Vision's 192nd station in Queensland and our 608th nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A Programme Guide for Mt Isa can be found here.</a></p>
content.attribs: show_title= link_titles= show_intro= show_section= link_section= show_category= link_category= show_vote= show_author= show_create_date= show_modify_date= show_pdf_icon= show_print_icon= show_email_icon= language= keyref= readmore=

content.title: Welcome to Siesta Park near Busselton!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners just tuning in from the Busselton area of WA. We are so thrilled to be able to announce our 607th station nationwide which has gone on in a former television exclusion zone on November 12. Many thanks to Grace College who have been instrumental in helping us obtain a site for the new station. Vision Siesta Park 87.6 FM is the 139th relay station in Western Australia. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Siesta Park (Busselton) can be found here</a>. </p>
content.attribs: show_title= link_titles= show_intro= show_section= link_section= show_category= link_category= show_vote= show_author= show_create_date= show_modify_date= show_pdf_icon= show_print_icon= show_email_icon= language= keyref= readmore=

content.title: Welcome to Marysville!
content.introtext: <p>A huge welcome to new listeners just tuning in from the town of Marysville in Victoria. This is a town close to the hearts of many Aussies who saw it devastated by the Black Saturday bushfires. Vision radio is so thrilled to be part of the rejuvenation and restoration of Marysville. Vision Marysville 87.6 FM started transmissions on November 5 and is the 606th installation to begin broadcasting nationwide as well as our 59th station in Victoria. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Marysville can be found here.</a></p>
content.attribs: show_title= link_titles= show_intro= show_section= link_section= show_category= link_category= show_vote= show_author= show_create_date= show_modify_date= show_pdf_icon= show_print_icon= show_email_icon= language= keyref= readmore=

content.title: Hello to Harvey, Snugglepot and Cuddlepie!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the town where Snugglepot and Cuddlepie grew up (or at least author, May Gibbs, did!) Yes, it's Harvey in WA and we're delighted to see this station become our 605th in Australia as well as the 138th in the west. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Harvey can be found here</a>.</p>
content.attribs: show_title= link_titles= show_intro= show_section= link_section= show_category= link_category= show_vote= show_author= show_create_date= show_modify_date= show_pdf_icon= show_print_icon= show_email_icon= language= keyref= readmore=

content.title: Welcome to Wannanup and Camperdown
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in to our two newest stations, coming on air the same day and the same frequency: Vision Camperdown 87.6 FM and Vision Wannanup 87.6 FM. Both began broadcasting on Friday 12 September. Camperdown is Vision's 58th relay station installed in Victoria and our 603rd station nationwide while Wannanup is the 137th in WA and our 604th overall. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">Programme guides for these two new stations can be found here.</a></p>
content.attribs: show_title= link_titles= show_intro= show_section= link_section= show_category= link_category= show_vote= show_author= show_create_date= show_modify_date= show_pdf_icon= show_print_icon= show_email_icon= language= keyref= readmore=

content.title: Welcome to Merimbula and Chidlow
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners just tuning in to newest relay stations at Merimbula and Chidlow which both went to air on 87.6 FM on Friday September 5. The stations are almost at opposite ends of the country; Merimbula is on the Sapphire Coast south of Sydney and Chidlow is on the eastern fringes of the Perth region. Vision Merimbula 87.6 FM is the 83rd installation in NSW while Vision Chidlow 87.6 FM is our 136th installation in WA. They bring to 602 the number of transmitters put in nationwide since Vision first began broadcasting in 1999.&nbsp;<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">Programme guides for Merimbula and Chidlow can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Deepwater!
content.introtext: <p>We're thrilled to welcome new listeners tuning in from Deepwater on the New England Highway between Glen Innes and Tenterfield in northern NSW. Vision Deepwater 87.6 FM began transmitting on Tuesday 19 August and it's our 599th installation across Australia. It's also the 81st relay station in NSW. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Deepwater can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Taroom!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in to our newest station on the Western Downs: Vision Taroom 87.6 FM. We're delighted to have the Taroom installation join Wandoan and Condamine North, extending coverage right across the region. Taroom began broadcasting on 13 August and is our 191st installation in Qld and our 598th across Australia. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Taroom can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Yealering
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Wheatbelt of WA. Vision Yealering 88.0 FM began transmitting on Monday 11 August, the result of five years of effort from faithful supporters in Western Australia. We are so pleased to be able to finally welcome Yealering to the Vision family! <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Wedderburn
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to residents tuning in from the Victorian town of Wedderburn. We're delighted to have you join the 'Vision family'.&nbsp; Vision Wedderburn 88.0 FM went to air for the first time on 13 July as our 57th station in Victoria. It's also our 596th installation across the nation. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Wedderburn can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Donnybrook, WA
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to residents in Western Australia tuning in to our newest station at Donnybrook. It's great to have you aboard! Vision Donnybrook 88.0 FM went to air for the first time on Thursday 10 July, bringing the complement of relay stations in WA to 134. It's also our 595th installation nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Donnybrook can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Kyabram and Boyup Brook
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome in these wintry days to listeners tuning in to two new relay stations just joining the Vision family. Both are broadcasting on 88.0 FM but they're at different ends of the country. Kyabram in Victoria first began transmitting on June 30 and Boyup Brook in Western Australia on July 4. We're delighted to welcome new listeners in these areas. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for the new stations can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Victor Harbor
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the beautiful southern beaches of the Fleurieu Peninsula. Victor Harbor joined the Vision family as our 592nd installation across the nation and our 62nd station in South Australia. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Victor Harbor can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Laidley
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners just tuning in from the Lockyer Valley. Vision Laidley 87.6 FM is our 588th installation nationwide and went to air on 9 April. We are delighted to have you join us! <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Laidley can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Romsey
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Macedon Ranges. Vision Romsey 87.6FM began broadcasting on Friday 28 March and is our 55th station in Victoria. It's great to have you join the UCB family. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Romsey can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Upgrade at Mt Barker, WA
content.introtext: <p>The Vision Radio Network service at Mt Barker in the Great Southern Region of Western Australia has been upgraded. The station now broadcasts on 3000 watts, extending the 'footprint' of the transmission considerably. We'd love to hear from listeners about the upgrade and how it has affected your listening experience both at home and in the car. We're also delighted to welcome new listeners tuning in from the region to Vision Mount Barker 93.7 FM.<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides"> A programme guide for Mt Barker can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Woodgate
content.introtext: <p>We're so thrilled to have already heard from new listeners tuning in from Woodgate near Bundaberg in Qld. The station was only on for 24 hours before the locals contacted us to say how excited they are. Vision Woodgate 88.0 FM arrived on 4 March and is our 188th relay station in Qld. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Woodgate can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Georgetown QLD
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from a very warm town on the Savannah Way about 400 km west of Cairns. It's been a substantial wait for locals as it's taken so long for one of our technicians to be able to get out their way. Thanks for your patience! Vision Georgetown 87.6 FM finally began broadcasting on 17 December, just in time for Christmas. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide can be found here.</a></p>

content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Whitsundays region of North Qld. Vision Bloomsbury 88.0 FM began broadcasting on December 10 as our 186th station in Qld and our 583rd installation nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Bloomsbury can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Dunolly VIC
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners just tuning in from the Victorian goldfields. Vision Dunolly 87.6 FM is our 54th relay station in Victoria and began broadcasting on 8 December 2013. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Dunolly can be found here.</a></p>

content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Queensland mining town of Wandoan in the western Darling Downs. Vision Wandoan 87.6 FM first began broadcasting on 6 November. It is our 581st station nationwide and our 185th station in Queensland. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Wandoan can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Maryborough, VIC
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from our 580th station which began broadcasting on October 5 in the Goldfields region of Victoria. Vision Maryborough 87.6 FM is our 53rd station in Victoria and we're delighted to be able to say g'day to everyone just joining us from the town. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Maryborough can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Mulga Queen
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from another remote indigenous community in the Laverton area of Western Australia. It's so cool to be able to say g'day to listeners from a third station in the area, our 129th installation in the west. Vision Mulga Queen 88.0 FM is our 579th station nationwide and first went to air on 20 September 2013. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">Programme guides for all these new stations can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Mount Margaret and Cosmo Newberry
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from two remote indigenous communities in the Laverton area of Western Australia. We're delighted to be able to say g'day to listeners from Mount Margaret and Cosmo Newberry (Cosmo Newbery), our 127th and 128th installations in the west. Vision Mount Margaret 88.0 FM is our 577th station nationwide and Vision Cosmo Newberry 88.0 FM is our 578th. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">Programme guides for both these new stations can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Noonkanbah
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Kimberleys. On September 3, a new Vision station was installed in the Mount Hardman area by <em>Chariots of Fire</em> ministries. We're so pleased to partner with them in bringing Vision radio to the most remote parts of Australia. Vision Noonkanbah 87.6 FM is the 126th installation in WA and our 576th nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Noonkanbah can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to One Arm Point
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners just tuning in from the awesome Kimberley region! We delighted to be able to say 'hello' to everyone who has recently joined the Vision family from One Arm Point in Western Australia. Vision One Arm Point 88.0 FM first began broadcasting on 19 August.<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides"> A programme guide for One Arm Point can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Avoca
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to our newest listeners tuning in from the Grampians in Victoria. We're delighted to be able to say 'hi' to supporters from the Central Highlands where Vision Avoca 87.6 FM has just began transmitting - the station went 'live' on 11 August. It's our 52nd station in Victoria and our 574th nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guides" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Avoca is available here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Landsdale!
content.introtext: <p>It's a great pleasure to be able to welcome new listeners tuning in from WA. A new Vision station began broadcasting on 7 August, filling in a gap in the coverage in the northern suburbs of Perth. Vision Landsdale 87.6 FM is our 124th station in the west and our 573rd station nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Landsdale can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Yarra Glen
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Victorian valley famous for its vineyards: Yarra Glen. Vision Yarra Glen 87.6 FM was switched on and began broadcasting on July 27. We're thrilled to be able to welcome our 51st Victorian relay station and our 572nd nationwide installation. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Yarra Glen can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Empire Vale is 80th NSW station
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from Empire Vale in the Ballina region of northern NSW. We're delighted to be able to welcome everyone from this tiny town between the river and the sea - our 80th Vision station in NSW. Vision Empire Vale 87.8 FM began transmitting on Saturday July 6 and is our 571st installation nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Empire Vale can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Bremer Bay
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to our new listeners tuning in from the beautiful southern coastal town of Bremer Bay in WA. Vision Bremer Bay 88.0 FM began broadcasting on 5 July 2013 and is our 123<sup>rd</sup> relay station in WA. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guide-pdfs">A printable programme guide for Bremer Bay can be found here</a>. <a target="_self" title="Electronic Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/epg">The electronic guide can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to City Beach and Guyra!
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to two new stations in the Vision Radio Network: City Beach in Perth and Guyra in northern NSW.</p> <p>We're delighted to welcome new listeners from the west tuning in on Vision City Beach 88.0 FM and from the Northern Tablelands on Vision Guyra 87.6 FM. City Beach is finally on air after many years of effort and is our 122nd station in Western Australia. It began broadcasting on June 19. Guyra is our 79th in NSW and transmissions began there on June 20.<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides"> A programme guide for these new stations can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: 50th Victorian station in Talbot!
content.introtext: <p>Woohoo! A big shout-out to our newest Vision station - the 50th in Victoria. We're so pleased to achieve this milestone and to welcome listeners tuning in from the delightful town of Talbot, just two hours north-west of Melbourne. Vision Talbot 87.6 FM is our 567th installation nationwide and began broadcasting on 8 June 2013. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Vision Talbot 87.6 FM can be found here.</a></p>

content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the Shire of Victoria Plains. Vision Calingiri 88.0 FM began broadcasting on Thursday May 30 and is our 121st realy station in Western Australia. We delighted to have you aboard!<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides"> A programme guide for Vision Calingiri is available here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Rainbow, Victoria
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in from the Mallee in north-west Victoria. Our 562<sup>nd</sup> station across Australia began transmitting on Saturday 13 April from the small agricultural town of Rainbow. Vision Rainbow 87.6 FM is our 48<sup>th</sup> Victorian relay station. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Rainbow can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Ungarra and Mooloolaba
content.introtext: <p>It's our great delight to be able to announce the arrival of two new stations in the Vision family this week, one in South Australia and one in Queensland. A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in from Ungarra on the Eyre Peninusla and Mooloolaba on the Sunshine Coast. Vision Ungarra 87.6 FM began transmitting on 7 April and Vision Mooloolaba 88.0 FM started on 8 April. They are our 560th and 561st stations respectively across Australia. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for each of these new stations can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Port Elliot and Grafton
content.introtext: <p>How wonderful to be able to welcome listeners tuning in from two new relay stations in the last week. Vision is so delighted to be able to say 'hello' to new listeners from the Fleurieu Peninsula in South Australia and the Clarence River Valley in NSW. Vision Port Elliot 87.8 FM began transmissions on 20 March and, just a day later on 21 March, Vision Grafton 1611 AM was switched on. We'd be thrilled to hear your reports about the quality of reception at these new locations. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Grafton and Port Elliot can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Vision comes to Binalong Bay
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in for the first time in the Bay of Fires area of Tasmania. Vision Binalong Bay 87.8 FM began transmissions on Monday 25 February 2013 as our 47th relay station in Tasmania and our 557th nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Binalong Bay can be found here.</a></p>

content.title: Welcome to Bathurst
content.introtext: <p>A huge hello to listeners tuning in from the Central Tablelands of NSW where our 556th station has just gone on air. Vision Bathurst 1629 AM began transmitting at the top of the AM band on February 22. The transmitter is located about 20 km south of Bathurst and the radio 'footprint' should have a radius of around 50km. So we are delighted to be able to provide this service to a wide regional area.<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides"> A programme guide for the new Bathurst service can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Elliston
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to the Vision family to new listeners tuning in from the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia. The most recent Vision station was switched on last night (Tuesday February 5) in the town of Elliston. It's our 555th nationwide installation and our 59th in South Australia.<a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/programme-guides"> A programme guide for Vision Elliston 88.0 FM can be found by clicking here.</a></p>

content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from North West Cape in Western Australia. Vision Exmouth 87.6 FM began transmitting on 1 February 2013. <strong><a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Exmouth can be found here.</a></strong></p>

content.title: Welcome to Delegate NSW
content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to new listeners tuning in from the high mountain Monaro region of NSW, right on the Victorian border. Vision Delegate 88.0 FM arrived on Christmas Eve 2012 - a great seasonal gift, not to mention our 75th station in NSW! It's great to have you with us. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Delegate can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Yalgoo
content.introtext: A very warm welcome to listeners tuning in to our second station in a week to come on air in the Murchison region of WA. It is with tremendous pleasure that we say 'hello' to all those people who in the town where 'the outback starts' and where the world's largest collection of wildflowers can be seen between late July and November each year. Vision Yalgoo 88.0 FM began transmitting on 14 December 2012 and is our 552nd station nationwide. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Yalgoo can be found here</a>.

content.title: Hello to Sandstone!
content.introtext: A very warm welcome to listeners from the town of Sandstone in the East Murchison area. We're delighted to have you tuning in to the latest Vision station to begin transmitting in Western Australia: Vision Sandstone 88.0 FM. The new station began broadcasting on 12/12/12 and is our 121st station in WA. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Sandstone can be found here</a>.

content.introtext: On the first day of summer, station #550 joined the Vision Radio Network. We're delighted to be able to say g'day to new listeners tuning in from the east Gippsland area. Vision Orbost 87.6 FM is our 48th station in Victoria and we extend a very warm welcome to everyone just joining us from the region. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Orbost can be found here.</a>

We're delighted to welcome you to the Vision family. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Wondai and Ballidu can be found here.</a>

content.title: Welcome to Roxby Downs
content.introtext: A very warm welcome to all our new listeners tuning in from the 'most modern town in the outback': Roxby Downs. Our most recent Vision station began transmitting yesterday - 19 November 2012 - in South Australia on 87.6 FM. We're so delighted to be able to say 'hello' for the very first time to listeners at our 58th South Australian station. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Roxby Downs can be found here.</a>

content.introtext: <p>A very warm and special 'hello' to new listeners tuning in from the towns of <strong>Macksville</strong> in Nambucca Shire, NSW, and <strong>Gibson</strong> near Esperance in WA. We're delighted to have you join us! Vision Macksville 87.6 FM began broadcasting on 13 November 2012 and just a day later, Vision Gibson 88.0 FM began transmitting. Macksville is our 74th installation in NSW and Gibson is our 119th installation in WA. <a target="_self" title="Vision Programme Guide" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides">A programme guide for Macksville and Gibson can be found here</a>.</p>

content.title: Picked Fresh in Cressy
content.introtext: <p>Picked fresh, snap frozen and filmed in Tassie!&nbsp;So goes the Birds Eye ad. Well, Vision radio isn't snap frozen but it's certainly fresh in Cressy,&nbsp;the town of Birds Eye peas. Welcome to all our new listeners tuning in to Vision Cressy 88.0 FM in Tassie's trout capital. Vision came to Cressy on 11 August and is our 46th station in the Apple (oops! Green Pea) Isle. A programme guide for Cressy can be found <a target="_self" href="http://www.vision.org.au/vision/programme-guides/" title="Vision Programme Guide">here</a>.</p>

content.title: Welcome to Kalumburu
content.introtext: A very warm welcome to new listeners from the very top of Western Australia. We're delighted to be able to welcome everyone from the Wunambal and Kwini people tuning in from the northernmost town&nbsp;of WA and the community of Kalumburu. Vision Kalumburu 88.0 FM began transmitting on August 1 and is the 117th station in WA. content.title: Floods at Vision Waaia 1413AM
content.introtext: <p><img src="images/waiia_transmitter.jpg" title="Waaia transmitter" /></p> <p>The 1413 AM&nbsp;tower in Waaia/Numurkah&nbsp;has been surrounded by floodwaters for more than a week.&nbsp;Locals have been&nbsp;amazed that, despite the Victorian floods,&nbsp;the station has continued to transmit.&nbsp;The farm where the tower is located has been completely underwater during the height of the flood and the tower base along with it. By God's grace, the house yard, which is surrounded by a levee bank, was spared even though the levee blew out a few times and four pumps were needed to keep the water out. The broken creek shown in the picture above&nbsp;is usually only 10 metres wide. It was about 7km wide at the high flood level.<br /><br /></p>

content.title: 500th station at Murphys Creek
content.introtext: <p>Vision is so thrilled to be able to announce its 500th station. We're even more delighted to be able to say that it covers Murphys Creek, the tiny town below the Great Dividing Range at Toowoomba Qld which was the scene of so much heartache in January this year when an 'inland tsunami' spilled over the side of the mountain and swept cars away and even houses off their stumps. Vision Murphys Creek 88.0 FM is one of our rare solar-powered stations and it began broadcasting on Friday 26 August. A programme guide for Murphys Creek can be found <a target="_self" href="images/stories/pdf_files/programme_guide_QLD.pdf" title="Vision Programme Guide">here</a>.</p>

content.introtext: <p>A very warm welcome to our new listeners tuning in on our two new South-east Queensland stations. Vision Upper Coomera 87.8 FM joined the Vision family last Monday on July 25 and, just one day later, Vision Gleneagle 87.8 FM began transmitting as well. We're delighted that, as we approach 500 stations, that Gleneagle - just down the road from Beaudesert, our very&nbsp;first station which began broadcasting on 1 February 1999. Gleneagle is our 172nd Qld station.</p> <p>A Programme Guide for Gleneagle and Upper Coomera can be found <a target="_self" href="http://www.vision.org.au/images/stories/pdf_files/programme_guide_QLD.pdf" title="Vision Programme Guide">here</a>.</p>

content.title: Vision comes to Camooweal
content.introtext: <p>Welcome to all our new listeners on the Barkly Tableland, on the Qld-NT border. The road between Mt Isa and its 'suburb' Camooweal is the longest main street in the world at 188 km - and our latest Vision station covers just a small section of it. But we're delighted to be able to say 'hello' to everyone tuning in from the Qld outback. Vision Camooweal 88.0 FM arrived on Thursday 2 June 2011. A programme guide for Camooweal can be found <a target="_self" href="http://www.vision.org.au/images/stories/pdf_files/programme_guide_QLD.pdf" title="Vision Programme Guide">here</a>.</p>

content.title: WA nearing 100 relay stations
content.introtext: <p>A big hello to our new listeners in rural WA. &nbsp;Vision Meckering 88.0 FM began broadcasting on Friday 14 May.&nbsp;Only 50 km by road from Meckering is Tammin, another wheatbelt town and the location of yet another new Vision station.&nbsp;Vision Tammin 88.0 FM began transmitting on Monday May 17. It is the 98th station in WA. Welcome to everyone tuning in! It's great to have you here.</p>

content.title: Wesley Mission Easter Service LIVE on Vision
content.introtext: <p><img align="right" width="400" alt="" src="http://www.wesleymission.org.au/images/Easter2010/large/eastersunrise2.jpg" /></p> <p class="cmbody">As the sun emerges across Sydney Harbour on Resurrection Sunday, well-known songs of praise will rise from the Sydney Opera House. <b>Debra Byrne, Steve Grace and Steve McPherson</b> will join with the Wesley Institute choir and hundreds of congregational voices, to celebrate the power and joy of Jesus' resurrection. Wesley Mission Superintendent, Rev Dr Keith Garner will preach on the risen Lord who leads us to a new beginning. This is just a part of what you can expect this Sunday morning at the Wesley Mission Easter Sunday service which is held at the Sydney Opera House.</p>

content.title: Daylight savings ends this weekend
content.introtext:
<a href=/downloadProgram.htm><img src=/images/prog_guide_2010_low-res.jpg align=right width=200 border=0></a><p class=cmbody><b>Daylight Savings ends this weekend!</b> That means listeners in NSW, ACT, VIC, TAS and SA will need to turn their watches <b>BACK</b> one hour on Saturday night before bed.</p>
<p>It also means that everything that listeners in these states hear on Vision will be heard an hour earlier than its been over summer. With 5 time zones across the country in Summer and 3 in Winter, broadcasting in real time is a real challenge. To make it less confusing for you, we've produced programme guides for each state. <a href=/downloadProgram.htm>GRAB ONE HERE...</a>

content.title: Programme line-up changes
content.introtext: <p>Last year we held a 'Radio Check-up' survey asking for your opinions and feedback on programmes heard on Vision and other general comments/suggestions. We have taken time to analyse the results and have made some programming changes (effective today) based on your feedback. While we obviously can't please all of our listeners all of the time, we hope that the changes will mean an overall better listening experience.</p> <p>Here's a summary of the changes that have been made and a list of new programmes that have been introduced (listed alphabetically):</p>

content.title: Another Vision station just before Christmas
content.introtext: <p>Vision Ganmain 87.6 FM started transmitting on 22 December and became the 55th Vision Relay station in NSW ... and the 77th so far for 2009!</p> <p>Ganmain is a small town about 50km east of Narrandera and 60 km west of Wagga Wagga. With a population of about 600, Ganmain claims the title of hay centre of Australia. Welcome to all our new listeners in the Riverina.</p>
